title: Present Tense Conjugation (-ω, -eis, -ei).
reading_greek: Εγώ μένω στην Αθήνα. Εσύ μένεις στην Πάτρα. Αυτός μένει στο σπίτι. Εμείς μένουμε εδώ.
reading_english: I live in Athens. You (singular) live in Patras. He lives at home. We live here.
audio_script: Welcome to Week 8 of your Greek lessons. Today we focus on the Present Tense Conjugation, specifically the endings for singular subjects and the first person plural: -ω, -εις, -ει, and -ουμε. ... Remember that in Greek, the verb ending tells you who is performing the action. ... Let’s use the verb 'μένω', meaning 'I live' or 'I stay', as our example. ...  Listen to the full conjugation now. ... Εγώ μένω, I live. ... Εσύ μένεις, you live. ... Αυτός, αυτή, or αυτό μένει, he, she, or it lives. ... And finally, Εμείς μένουμε, we live. ...  Now, listen to a short reading passage using these forms. ...  [Reading Greek] ... Εγώ μένω στην Αθήνα. Εσύ μένεις στην Πάτρα. Αυτός μένει στο σπίτι. Εμείς μένουμε εδώ. ... Now, repeat after me: ... Μένω. ... Μένεις. ... Μένει. ... Μένουμε. ... Great work. Now try reading the passage yourself.
